```{r Read in data layers}
#CDL floral resources, nesting, and foraging 
reclass_floral <- read.csv("CA_bees_floral.csv") |> na.omit()
reclass_nest <- read.csv("CA_bees_nesting.csv") |> na.omit()
reclass_lifehist <- read.csv("CA_bees_forage.csv") |> na.omit()

```

```{r Create parameters}
cell_size <- 30 #30x30 m cell size
spec_num <- nrow(reclass_lifehist) #7 species in guild table
tstep <- 1 #time step

#Create raster file path
#Rasters taken from https://croplandcros.scinet.usda.gov/
base <- "Tiff Files/cdl_Yolo_"
raster_path <- paste0(base, tstep + 2012, ".TIF") #create raster path based on time step
```

```{r Create empty arrays}
curr_LC <- terra::rast(raster_path) #assign current time step raster
crop_extent <- c(566938.2, 626938.2, 4236149, 4296149)
curr_LC <- terra::crop(curr_LC, crop_extent)
nr <- nrow(curr_LC) #number of rows in raster file
nc <- ncol(curr_LC) #number of columns in raster file
# array for queens, max queens, final queen numbers, pollinator score, dispersers
queen_array <- max_queen_array <- queen_array_fin <- pol_ls_score <- dispersers <- array(0, dim = c(nr, nc, spec_num, 11))
```

```{r Initialize queens}
queen_seed <- array(0, dim = c(nr, nc, spec_num))
#generate random number (0-1) in 10x10 array in the center of raster file
queen_seed[1016:1025, 1021:1030, ] <- array(runif(n = (10 * 10 * spec_num)), dim = c(10, 10, spec_num))

#Assign a queen to a cell in array if > 0.8 (20% of cells will receive a queen)
queen_array[ , , , 1] <- ifelse(queen_seed > 0.8, 1, 0)
```


```{r For loop}
#Calc weighted average of foraging quality using foraging activity prop 
for (t in 1:21) {
  #Pull new raster file after 10 years of initializing
  if (t > 11) {
    raster_path <- paste0(base, (t+2012-10), ".TIF") #assign new raster file based on time step
    curr_LC <- terra::rast(raster_path) #current land cover raster
    curr_LC <- terra::crop(curr_LC, crop_extent) #crop land cover to same extent
  }
  
  #Land cover types for raster file
#  type <- terra::unique(curr_LC)[,1] #create a vector of  unique land cover values
#  LC_type <- data.frame(type = type, #land cover types in raster file
#                    num_pix = 0) #create empty column for number of pixels of each type
#  num_LC <- nrow(LC_type) #number of land cover types in raster file
  tot_LC <- nrow(reclass_nest) #number of land cover values in biophys table
  
  #How many pixels of each cover type
#  for (i in 1:num_LC) {
#    type_i <- LC_type$type[i]
#    LC_type$num_pix[i] <- sum(values(curr_LC) == type_i, na.rm = T)
#  }
  
  #How many pixels of each cover type
  LC_type <- terra::freq(curr_LC)[, -1]
  names(LC_type) <- c("type", "num_pix")

  #Per capita reproduction rate
  for (s in 1:spec_num) {
    #Maximum number of nests per cell and max queens produced per nest
    max_nest <- reclass_lifehist$Nests[s] #maximum number of nests within a cell
    max_rep <- reclass_lifehist$Rep[s] #maximum number of queens produced per nest
    
    #Foraging distance matrix
    forage_dist <- reclass_lifehist$Disp[s] #foraging distance for each species
    radius <- 2*round(forage_dist/cell_size) #foraging radius in cells
      #WHY IS IT 2*THE ROUNDED VALUE
    X <- seq(-radius, radius) #all integers between -radius and radius
    Y <- seq(-radius, radius) #all integers between -radius and radius
    XY_grid <- expand.grid(X=X, Y=Y) 
    
    dist_mat <- cell_size * sqrt(XY_grid$X^2 + XY_grid$Y^2) #distance to center of circle 
    dist_mat_decay <- exp(-dist_mat/forage_dist) * (dist_mat <= 2 * forage_dist) #exp decay to transform square into circle
    eff_forage <- sum(dist_mat_decay) #sum of circle distance matrix
    filter <- dist_mat_decay/eff_forage #normalized distant matrix
    
    #Initialize floral and nesting habitat
    HF <- matrix(curr_LC, nrow = nr, ncol = nc) #matrix of raster values
    HN <- matrix(curr_LC, nrow = nr, ncol = nc)
    LS <- matrix(0, nrow = nr, ncol = nc)
    
    #Reclass landcover for each cover type by species 
    for (i in 1:tot_LC) {
      HF[HF == reclass_floral[i,1]] <- reclass_floral[i, s + 1]/100
      HN[HN == reclass_nest[i,1]] <- reclass_nest[i, s + 1]/100
    }
    
    #Disperse queens
    if (t > 1) {
      #Calculate maximum number of queens per cell given landscape conditions
      max_queen_array[,,s,t] <- matrix(1, nrow = nr, ncol = nc) * max_nest * HN 
      #Takes the smallest value between the two arrays. The number of queens in a cell cannot exceed the maximum.
      queen_array[,,s,t] <- pmin(dispersers[,,s,t-1], max_queen_array) 
      forage <- convolve(HF, filter, type = "open") #Convolution
      pol_ls_score[,,s] <- HN * forage 
        #WHAT IS HAPPENING HERE ^^
      
      rep_temp <- matrix(rnorm(nr*nc), nrow = nr, ncol = nc)
      range <- max(rep_temp) - min(rep_temp)
      standardized <- floor(max_rep * 2 * (rep_temp - min(rep_temp))/range)
      rep <- queen_array[,,s,t] * (standardized * forage)
      # dispersers[,,s,t] <- 
    }
  }
}
```
